tit.cmt: gableには切妻なども含まれるようなので、ローマ字表記にしました。

sen.j: 破風(はふ)は、切妻造や入母屋造などにできる、妻側の三角形部分の造形。
sen.e: A gable is the triangular shaped part on the narrow side of a gabled or hip-and-gabled roof.
A gable is the triangular shaped part on the narrow side of a gabled or hip-and-gabled roof.
Hafu is the triangular shaped part on the narrow side of kirizuma-zukuri style (an architectural style with a gabled roof) or irimoya style (building with a half-hipped roof).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 妻壁や破風板などを含む。
sen.e: It includes the gable wall and gable boards.
It includes the gable wall and gable boards.
It includes the gable wall and gable boards.

sen.j: 寺院や城郭建築などで大きく発展が見られた。
sen.e: Significant developments were seen in the gables on temples and castles.
Significant developments were seen in the gables on temples and castles.
Significant developments were seen in the hafu on temples and castles.

sen.j: 通常、一般住宅の妻壁部分には、板張や漆喰などで仕上げられ、母屋には小さな破風板や化粧板金が付けられるが、城郭建築や寺院建築の妻壁には、格子や漆喰、また「豕扠首（いのこさす）」などの化粧材を見せることもある。
sen.e: Usually the gable walls in ordinary housing are finished with boarding or plaster and a small gable board or decorative metal plate is added however the gable walls in temple construction or castle construction feature decorative materials such as lattice work and plaster, or diagonal braces.

Usually the gable walls in ordinary housing are finished with boarding or plaster and a small gable board or decorative metal plate is added however the gable walls in temple construction or castle construction feature decorative materials such as lattice work and plaster, or diagonal braces.

Usually the gable walls in ordinary housing are finished with boarding or plaster and a small gable board or decorative metal plate is added however the gable walls in temple construction or castle construction feature decorative materials such as lattice work and plaster, or diagonal braces.

sen.j: 幅の広い破風板に漆喰や黒漆などを塗布し、懸魚という飾り板を取り付けることが多い。
sen.e: Wide gable boards were often painted with plaster or black lacquer and feature ornamental features called 'kegyo.'
Wide gable boards were often painted with plaster or black lacquer and feature ornamental features called 'kegyo.'
Wide gable boards were often painted with plaster or black lacquer and feature ornamental features called 'gegyo.'

sen.j: 破風板に飾り金具を付けるとさらに華美になる。
sen.e: The addition of decorative metal fittings on the gable creates an even more ornate look.
The addition of decorative metal fittings on the gable creates an even more ornate look.
The addition of decorative metal fittings on the gable board creates an even more ornate look.

sen.j: 破風には入母屋破風や唐破風などの種類がある。
sen.e: There are several types of gables such as hip-and-gable and Chinese gables.
There are several types of gables such as hip-and-gable and Chinese gables.
There are several types of hafu such as irimoya hafu and Chinese gables.

sen.j: 以下に書き出した。
sen.e: These are described below.
These are described below.
These are described below.

sen.j: 入母屋破風
sen.e: Irimoya gable
Irimoya gable
Irimoya Hafu

sen.j: 入母屋屋根にできる破風。
sen.e: A gable in an Irimoya (hip-and-gable) roof.
A gable in an Irimoya (hip-and-gable) roof.
A hafu in an Irimoya (hip-and-gable) roof.

sen.j: 破風の代表的なもの。
sen.e: Representative of gables.
Representative of gables.
Representative of hafu.

sen.j: 城郭建築(天守)や武家様式の建物などで多く見ることができる。
sen.e: This type can be seen frequently in samurai style buildings and castle construction (tower).
This type can be seen frequently in samurai style buildings and castle construction (tower).
This type can be seen frequently in samurai style buildings and castle construction (tenshu (main keep or tower of a castle)).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 特に大きなものは大入母屋ともいい、破風板や懸魚もあわせて大きくなる。
sen.e: Particularly large ones are called large hip-and-gable and the gable boards and ornate features are also larger.
Particularly large ones are called large hip-and-gable and the gable boards and ornate features are also larger.
Particularly large ones are called Oirimoya (big irimoya) and the gable boards and gegyo features are also larger.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 二条城御殿、姫路城大天守が代表的。
sen.e: Nijo Castle palace and Himeji Castle tower are representative of this type.
Nijo Castle palace and Himeji Castle tower are representative of this type.
Nijo-jo Castle Palace and Tenshu of Himeji-jo Castle are representative of this type.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 千鳥破風
sen.e: Chidori (plover) gable
Chidori (plover) gable
Chidori (plover) Hafu

sen.j: 切妻破風を葺き降ろしの屋根に直接置いて造られる。
sen.e: Made by putting the gable directly on the roof of a kirizuma gable.
Made by putting the gable directly on the roof of a kirizuma gable.

Made by putting kirizuma hafu (gable built on a kirizuma) directly on the roof of fukioroshi (the extension of a roof or the elongation of eaves on the main part of a building in order to cover an adjacent area).
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 主に天守建築に見ることができる。
sen.e: Mainly seen in tower construction.
Mainly seen in tower construction.
Mainly seen in Tenshu construction.

sen.j: 古くは、大きな屋根などで、窓の開口が難しくなった階層などに出窓のように突起して屋根を被せたもの(破風部屋)で、時代が下がるにつれて単に飾りというだけのものとなり、小屋裏に部屋さえも持たなくなることが多くなった。
sen.e: In the old days these were often built in the form of window rooms in the upper storeys of large roofs in which it was difficult to make a window opening (gable room) and through the ages these have mostly simply become decorative features with no room behind in the roof.

In the old days these were often built in the form of window rooms in the upper storeys of large roofs in which it was difficult to make a window opening (gable room) and through the ages these have mostly simply become decorative features with no room behind in the roof.

In the old days these were often built in the form of window rooms in the upper storey of large roofs in which it was difficult to make a window opening (hafu room) and through the ages these have mostly simply become decorative features with no room behind in the roof.

sen.j: 比翼破風・比翼入母屋破風
sen.e: Wing gables and winged irimoya gables
Wing gables and winged irimoya gables
Hiyoku hafu (Wing gables) and Hiyoku Irimoya Hafu (winged irimoya gables)

sen.j: 元は、大入母屋から作り出されたと考えられ、主に天守建築で見られる。
sen.e: It is thought that they originated in large irimoya gables and are mostly seen in tower construction.
It is thought that they originated in large irimoya gables and are mostly seen in tower construction.
It is thought that they originated in oirimoya gables and are mostly seen in Tenshu construction.

sen.j: 規模の大きな天守に多く見られ、初期のものは、大入母屋の代わりに、比翼入母屋破風を造り、不整形な平面からの歪みを整えた。
sen.e: These are most often seen in large scale towers and the earliest ones were built with winged irimoya gables instead of large irimoya gables, neatening any distortions in irregular plane surfaces.
These are most often seen in large scale towers and the earliest ones were built with winged irimoya gables instead of large irimoya gables, neatening any distortions in irregular plane surfaces.
These are most often seen in large scale Tenshu and the earliest ones were built with hiyoku irimoya hafu instead of oirimoya gables, neatening any distortions in irregular plane surfaces.

sen.j: 時代が下がると、層塔式天守や御殿の屋根に千鳥破風で全くの飾りとして付けられるようになる。
sen.e: Down through the ages these came to be added to chidori gables on palace roofs and pagoda-style palaces solely for decoration.
Down through the ages these came to be added to chidori gables on palace roofs and pagoda-style palaces solely for decoration.
Down through the ages these came to be added to chidori hafu on palace roofs and pagoda-style palaces solely for decoration.

sen.j: 唐破風
sen.e: Chinese gable
Chinese gable
Kara Hafu (literally, Tang gable)
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 唐破風は、日本特有の形式で、切妻のむくり屋根の先に独特のフォルムの破風板が付けられる。
sen.e: Chinese gables have a characteristic Japanese shape which is a rising arch shaped roof on a kirizuma gable with the addition of an original form of gable boarding.
Chinese gables have a characteristic Japanese shape which is a rising arch shaped roof on a kirizuma gable with the addition of an original form of gable boarding.
Kara hafu has a characteristic Japanese shape which is a rising arch shaped roof on a kirizuma gable with the addition of an original form of gable boarding.

sen.j: 城郭建築や、近世の寺院などで多く見られる。
sen.e: It is often seen on castle construction and modern temples.
It is often seen on castle construction and modern temples.
It is often seen on castle construction and modern temples.

sen.j: 装飾性は非常に高い。
sen.e: It is highly decorative.
It is highly decorative.
It is highly decorative.

sen.j: 大きな邸宅の玄関としてつけられることもあり、現在の和風住宅でも稀に付けられることがある。
sen.e: They are also sometimes seen as entrance halls on large residences and these days are occasionally added to Japanese style houses.
They are also sometimes seen as entrance halls on large residences and these days are occasionally added to Japanese style houses.
They are also sometimes seen as entrance halls on large residences and these days are occasionally added to Japanese style houses.

sen.j: 唐破風には向唐破風と軒唐破風の二つの形式がある。
sen.e: There are two styles of Chinese gable, including the Muko-karahafu and Noki-karahafu.
sen.cmt: 向唐破風 muko karahafu 軒唐破風 noki karahafu
sen.e: There are two styles of Chinese gable, including the Muko-karahafu and Noki-karahafu.
There are two styles of kara hafu gable, including the muko kara hafu and noki kara hafu.

sen.j: 向唐破風は、出窓のように独立して葺き下ろしの屋根の上に千鳥破風のようにして造られる。
sen.e: A Muko chinese gable is built like a Chidori gable or oriel window independently on the top of a roof.
A Muko chinese gable is built like a Chidori gable or oriel window independently on the top of a roof.
A muko kara hafu gable is built like a chidori hafu or oriel window independently on the top of a roof.

sen.j: 出窓として造られるものもあるが全くの飾りとして造られることも多い。
sen.e: Some are built as oriel windows and but most are merely decorative.
Some are built as oriel windows and but most are merely decorative.
Some are built as oriel windows and but most are merely decorative.

sen.j: 軒唐破風は、軒の一部にむくりをつけるか、むくりをつけた切妻に付けて造られる。
sen.e: A Noki chinese gable is built by adding an arch rise into part of the eaves (noki) or adding to an arched kirizuma gable.
A Noki chinese gable is built by adding an arch rise into part of the eaves (noki) or adding to an arched kirizuma gable.
A noki kara hafu gable is built by adding an arch rise into part of noki (the eaves) or adding to an arched kirizuma gable.

sen.j: 寺社建築などでも見ることができる。
sen.e: They can also be seen in temple and shrine construction.
They can also be seen in temple and shrine construction.
They can also be seen in temple and shrine construction.

sen.j: 切妻破風
sen.e: Kirizuma gable
Kirizuma gable
Kirizuma Hafu

sen.j: 切妻に造られる破風。
sen.e: A gable built on a kirizuma.
A gable built on a kirizuma.
A gable built on a kirizuma.

sen.j: 比較的シンプルに造られることが多く大規模なものは造られることが少ない。
sen.e: These are mostly built simply and they are rarely large scale.
These are mostly built simply and they are rarely large scale.
These are mostly built simply and they are rarely large scale.

sen.j: 破風板（はふいた）
sen.e: gable board
gable board
Gable Board

sen.j: 破風とは元々破風板の事を指していったと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that the Japanese term hafu or gable originally indicated the gable boards.
It is thought that the Japanese term hafu or gable originally indicated the gable boards.
It is thought that the Japanese term hafu originally indicated the gable boards.

sen.j: 建物のデザインにあうように、反りやむくりを付けたり、全くの直線に造ることもある。
sen.e: Some gable boards have curves or arches to suit the design of the building and some are straight.
Some gable boards have curves or arches to suit the design of the building and some are straight.
Some gable boards have curves or arches to suit the design of the building and some are straight.

sen.j: 溝や彫刻を施すこともある。
sen.e: Some have grooves or carving.
Some have grooves or carving.
Some have grooves or carving.

sen.j: 木材で造られることが多いが、住宅建築ではプラスチック製のものもある。
sen.e: Most are made of wood however some plastic boards are used in housing construction.
Most are made of wood however some plastic boards are used in housing construction.
Most are made of wood however some plastic boards are used in housing construction.

sen.j: 懸魚（げぎょ）
sen.e: Kegyo
Kegyo
Gegyo

sen.j: 懸魚は、破風板の下に取り付けられる装飾を目的に付けられる彫刻を施した板のこと。
sen.e: Kegyo are the carved wood pieces attached under the gable boards for decorative purposes.
Kegyo are the carved wood pieces attached under the gable boards for decorative purposes.
Gegyo are the carved wood pieces attached under the gable boards for decorative purposes.

sen.j: 板の中央付近に四葉（しよう）や六葉（ろくよう）と呼ばれる花形の彫刻、板の両端に鰭（ひれ）と呼ばれる彫刻をつけることが多い。
sen.e: The middle of the boards have carved flowers with four or six petals and on each side are carvings called fins.
The middle of the boards have carved flowers with four or six petals and on each side are carvings called fins.
The middle of the boards have carved flowers with four or six petals and on each side are carvings called fins.

sen.j: 発祥地と考えられている中国では垂魚とも呼ばれている。
sen.e: In China, where kegyo originate, they sometimes use different Chinese characters for Kegyo.
sen.cmt: 垂魚 different Chinese characters for Kegyo
sen.e: In China, where kegyo originate, they sometimes use different Chinese characters for Kegyo.
In China, where gegyo originate, they sometimes use different Chinese characters '垂魚' for gegyo.

sen.j: 読みは、一般的に「げぎょ」といわれるが「けんぎょ」と読むこともある。
sen.e: In Japan the characters are usually read Kegyo or sometimes Kengyo.
In Japan the characters are usually read Kegyo or sometimes Kengyo.
In Japan the characters are usually read 'gegyo' or sometimes 'Kengyo.'

sen.j: 蛙股・笈形（かえるまた・おいがた）
sen.e: Kaerumata frog-leg struts, Oigata
Kaerumata frog-leg struts, Oigata
Kaerumata (frog-leg struts) and Oigata (a sculptural decoration)

sen.j: 蛙股は、蛙の股のような造形から呼ばれる。
sen.e: Kaerumata are sculptures which look like frog's-legs, hence the name.
Kaerumata are sculptures which look like frog's-legs, hence the name.
Kaerumata are sculptures which look like frog's-legs, hence the name.

sen.j: 妻飾りにも用いられ、装飾と構造部材の役割を持ち、「透し」や「板」という種類がある。
sen.e: They are used to decorate the gables and have both decorative and structural roles, and types include sukashi and ita.
They are used to decorate the gables and have both decorative and structural roles, and types include sukashi and ita.
They are used to decorate the gables and have both decorative and structural roles, and types include 'sukashi' and 'ita.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: 中国では駱峰、朝鮮では、華版といわれる。
sen.e: In China they are called 'white horse peaks' and in Korea 'Kohan'.
sen.cmt: 駱峰 white horse peaks 華版 Kohan
sen.e: In China they are called 'white horse peaks' and in Korea 'Kohan'.
In China they are called 'rakuho' (駱峰, white horse peaks) and in Korea 'Kohan.'
sen.cmt: 読み不明の漢字を補足しました。

sen.j: 古くはシンプルなものが多く、近世、特に江戸中期以降では股の内側に彫刻を施すことがあり、時に、はみ出して造られたものもある。
sen.e: In olden days they were mostly simple and in modern times, particularly since the middle of the Edo period, carving was done on the inside of the frog's legs and some are made to protrude.
In olden days they were mostly simple and in modern times, particularly since the middle of the Edo period, carving was done on the inside of the frog's legs and some are made to protrude.
In olden days they were mostly simple and in modern times, particularly since the middle of the Edo period, carving was done on the inside of the frog's legs and some are made to protrude.

sen.j: 笈形は、蛙股の中央に瓶のような形をした短い束を立てたようなもの。
sen.e: Oigata is a scultural decoration which is a short shape shaped like a bottle standing in the middle of the kaerumata.
Oigata is a scultural decoration which is a short shape shaped like a bottle standing in the middle of the kaerumata.
Oigata is a sculptural decoration which is a short shape shaped like a bottle standing in the middle of the kaerumata.

sen.j: 機能は蛙股とほとんど同じである。
sen.e: The function is virtually the same as kaerumata.
The function is virtually the same as kaerumata.
The function is virtually the same as kaerumata.

sen.j: 双方とも、破風に限らず付けられる。
sen.e: Both are not limited to gables.
Both are not limited to gables.
Both are not limited to hafu.

sen.j: 近世以降では、唐破風によく見られる。
sen.e: In modern times they are often seen on Chinese gables.
In modern times they are often seen on Chinese gables.
In modern times they are often seen on kara hafu.
